metadata.job_to_be_done: Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items.

subsection_analysis.refined_text:  Ingredients : o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 cucumber o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice tomatoes, onion, and cucumber. o Mix vegetables with chopped cilantro, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve chilled. Käsespätzle (Cheese Noodles)  Ingredients : o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup milk o 3 eggs o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg o 1/4 cup butter o 1 cup grated cheese o 1 small onion  Instructions : o Mix flour, milk, beaten eggs, salt, and nutmeg to form a batter. o Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into boiling water. o Cook until spaetzle floats to the surface, then drain. o Sauté sliced onion in butter until golden. o Layer spaetzle and grated cheese in a baking dish, top with sautéed onion. o Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. o Serve warm. Kartoffelsalat (Potato Salad)  Ingredients : o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup bacon o 1/4 cup vinegar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon mustard o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper

 Ingredients : o 1 cup cornmeal o 1 cup flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1 cup milk o 1/4 cup vegetable oil o 1 egg  Instructions : o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add milk, oil, and beaten egg, stir until combined. o Pour batter into a greased baking pan. o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Coxinha  Ingredients : o 2 cups shredded chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1/4 cup cream cheese o 1 cup flour o 1 cup breadcrumbs o 2 eggs o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Mix shredded chicken with onion, garlic, chopped parsley, and cream cheese. o Form mixture into drumstick shapes. o Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Croque Monsieur  Ingredients : o 8 slices bread o 4 slices ham o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese o 1/4 cup béchamel sauce

 Ingredients : o 2 cups shredded chicken o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 apple o 1/4 cup raisins o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Dice onion, grate carrot, and chop apple. o Mix shredded chicken with onion, carrot, apple, raisins, mayonnaise, chopped parsley, and salt. o Serve chilled. Saltfish Fritters  Ingredients : o 1 pound salted cod o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup flour o 1/4 cup water o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake. o Mix cod with diced onion, minced garlic, flour, water, thyme, and salt. o Form mixture into fritters. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Samosa  Ingredients : o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup oil o 1/2 cup water o 2 potatoes o 1/2 cup peas o 1 small onion o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander

 Ingredients : o 2 cups black-eyed peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Soak black-eyed peas overnight, then peel and rinse. o Blend peas with diced onion, minced garlic, and salt until smooth. o Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Agedashi Tofu  Ingredients : o 1 block tofu o 1/4 cup cornstarch o 1 cup dashi broth o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon mirin o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup grated daikon  Instructions : o Cut tofu into cubes and coat with cornstarch. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Heat dashi broth with soy sauce and mirin. o Serve tofu in broth, topped with green onions and grated daikon. Aloo Gobi  Ingredients : o 2 potatoes o 1 cauliflower o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon salt o 2 tablespoons oil  Instructions : o Peel and dice potatoes, cut cauliflower into florets. o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent. o Add cumin, turmeric, coriander, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute.

 Ingredients : o 1/2 pound ground chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon rice powder o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions : o Sauté ground chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and rice powder in a bowl. o Toss chicken with the dressing, chopped mint, cilantro, and sliced chilies. o Serve with lettuce leaves. Lo Mein  Ingredients : o 8 ounces lo mein noodles o 1 cup sliced bell peppers o 1 cup snow peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  Instructions : o Cook lo mein noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. o Add bell peppers and snow peas, stir-fry until tender. o Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce, stir to combine. o Serve warm. Loubia  Ingredients : o 2 cups white beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin

 Ingredients : o 1 package egg roll wrappers o 1 cup shredded cabbage o 1/2 cup grated carrots o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce. Elote  Ingredients : o 4 ears of corn o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o 1/4 cup sour cream o 1/2 cup cotija cheese o 1 teaspoon chili powder o 1 lime  Instructions : o Grill the corn until charred. o Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl. o Brush the mixture onto the corn. o Sprinkle with cotija cheese and chili powder. o Squeeze lime juice over the top and serve. Empanadas  Ingredients : o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup butter o 1/4 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup raisins o 1 teaspoon cumin

 Ingredients : o 2 cups flour o 1 cup semolina o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup butter  Instructions : o Mix flour, semolina, and salt in a bowl. o Add water and knead until smooth. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into thin circles. o Brush with melted butter and fold into squares. o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. o Serve warm. Muhammara  Ingredients : o 2 red bell peppers o 1/2 cup walnuts o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Roast bell peppers until charred, then peel and seed. o Blend peppers, walnuts, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, olive oil, pomegranate molasses, cumin, and salt in a food processor until smooth. o Serve with pita bread. Mutabal  Ingredients : o 2 eggplants o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash.

 Ingredients : o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup water o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add coconut milk and water, stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Mandu  Ingredients : o 1 package dumpling wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 teaspoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce. Mango Sticky Rice  Ingredients : o 1 cup glutinous rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup sugar o 1/4 teaspoon salt o 2 mangoes  Instructions : o Rinse rice and soak in water for 1 hour. o Steam rice until tender. o Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt until dissolved.

 Ingredients : o 1 napa cabbage o 1/4 cup sea salt o 1 tablespoon sugar o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 4 cloves garlic o 1 inch ginger o 4 green onions  Instructions : o Cut cabbage into quarters and soak in salted water for 2 hours. o Rinse and drain cabbage. o Mix sugar, fish sauce, gochugaru, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green onions in a bowl. o Rub mixture onto cabbage leaves. o Pack cabbage into a jar and let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days. o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. Kongnamul Muchim  Ingredients : o 1 pound soybean sprouts o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions : o Blanch soybean sprouts in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss sprouts with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Labneh  Ingredients : o 2 cups yogurt o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions : o Mix yogurt with salt. o Place yogurt in a cheesecloth-lined strainer over a bowl. o Let drain in the refrigerator for 24 hours. o Transfer labneh to a serving dish and drizzle with olive oil. o Serve with pita bread.

 Ingredients : o 1 can chickpeas o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Japchae  Ingredients : o 8 ounces sweet potato noodles o 1/2 pound beef o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 bell pepper o 1 cup spinach o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions : o Cook noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté sliced beef, diced onion, julienned carrot, and bell pepper in sesame oil until cooked. o Add spinach and cook until wilted. o Mix noodles with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame seeds. o Combine with cooked beef and vegetables. o Serve warm. Jerk Vegetables  Ingredients : o 1 cup broccoli o 1 cup bell peppers o 1 cup zucchini o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons jerk seasoning

 Ingredients : o 1 cup water o 1/2 cup butter o 1 cup flour o 3 eggs o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 teaspoon cinnamon o Oil for frying  Instructions : o Bring water and butter to a boil. o Add flour and stir until a dough forms. o Remove from heat and beat in eggs one at a time. o Heat oil in a pan. o Pipe dough into hot oil and fry until golden. o Drain on paper towels and roll in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon. o Serve warm. Coconut Rice  Ingredients : o 1 cup rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup shredded coconut o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Sauté shredded coconut until lightly browned. o Add rice, coconut milk, water, and salt. o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm. Coleslaw  Ingredients : o 1 small cabbage o 2 carrots o 1/2 cup mayonnaise o 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions : o Shred cabbage and grate carrots. o Mix mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and salt in a bowl. o Toss cabbage and carrots with dressing. o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
